meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a bureaucracy.
meanings.sent1: The paperwork was filled out bureaucratically, following all the office rules.
meanings.sent2: She completed the forms bureaucratically, just like the government workers.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to navigate the bureaucratic ice maze to reach its fishy prize.
meanings.sent4: The vines grew bureaucratically, entwining around the fence like red tape.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked bureaucratically, marking each second with precision.

meanings.definition: With excessive adherence to rules and procedures.
meanings.sent1: He followed the instructions bureaucratically, checking every step multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The team worked bureaucratically, making sure not to miss any details.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner moved bureaucratically around the room, meticulously cleaning every corner.
meanings.sent4: The ants marched bureaucratically in a straight line, each following the one in front.
meanings.sent5: The gears turned bureaucratically, each tooth fitting perfectly into the next.
